intro: Sarcostemma bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its milky latex is a notable feature, often used in traditional medicine. Sarcostemma bicolor thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy and adaptable species.
